Minimum Wage.notes: 400.00 BYNs per month.
Ranges from 792 to 1,013 Japanese yen ($7.27–$9.29) per hour; set on a prefectural and industry basis.

The labor code allows the government to set a minimum hourly wage; however, the government has not exercised this provision except for setting the minimum wage for domestic workers at 440,000 GNF ($44.4) per month.
€584 per month, or €3.48 per hour.
Ranges from PhP243 ($4.60) daily non-agricultural wage in Ilocos to PhP537 ($10.16) daily non-agricultural wage in Metro Manila.
2100 Cuban pesos ($87.5) per month.
£8.25 per hour ($10.18) for those aged 18+ £6.15 per hour ($7.59) for those aged under 18 £7.30 per hour ($9.01) for development worker.

2,035 Mauritian rupees (US$51) per week for an unskilled worker in the Export Processing Zone (EPZ); 2,035 rupee per week for an unskilled factory worker outside the EPZ plus a "salary compensation" of 90 rupees per week; set by the government by sector, and increased each year based on the inflation rate. Both categories of workers also benefit from a "special allowance" from the revenue agency which means that all full-time workers in Mauritius earn a minimum wage of 2,250 rupees (US$62.76) per week or 9,000 rupees (US$251.05) per month
28,465 CFA francs ($57), supplemented by a required package of benefits, including social security and health care.
€1501.49 ($1735) per month; or €9.24 ($10) per hour for the lowest paying industry

8,310Dominican pesos ($166) per month in the FTZs and between 9,412 pesos ($188) and 15,448 pesos ($309) outside the FTZs, depending upon the size of the company; 5,884 pesos ($117) per month for the public sector; 320 pesos ($6) a day for farm workers who are covered by minimum wage regulations based on a 10-hour day, with the exception of sugarcane workers who received 146 pesos based on an eight-hour workday.

23 Swiss francs (25$) per hour in canton of Geneva, 20 Swiss francs ($22.14) per hour in the cantons Jura and Neuchâtel, the rest of the country has no minimum wage. There are a minority of the voluntary General Labour Contracts (GLC, collective labour agreements), reached on a sector-by-sector basis, contain minimum compensation clauses, which provide for compensation ranging from CHF 2,200 to 4,200 ($2214 to $4226) per month for unskilled workers and CHF 2,800 to 5,300 ($2818 to $5333) per month for skilled employees. On 18 May 2014, Swiss voters rejected a federal initiative (by 76.3%) that would have enforced GLCs for every sector and set the hourly minimum wage at CHF 22 ($22.14, or PPP-adjusted $12.55).
68,000 Armenian dram ($143) per month.
Varies by region; Region I: VND 3,980,000 per month; Region II: VND 3,530,000 per month; Region III: VND 3,090,000 per month and Region IV: VND 2,760,000 per month.

Most workers are covered by an award, which may vary by employee age, geographical location and industry. Workers receive mandatory employer superannuation contributions of at least 9.5% of wages, alongside loadings such as penalty rates or leave loading. Minimum wages are set federally by the Fair Work Commission. For those 21 and older, not covered by an award or other instrument, the minimum wages is A$753.80 (US$535.63) per week, or A$19.84 (US$15.36) per hour. Casual workers are paid a loading of typically 25%, resulting in a minimum of A$24.80 (US$19.25) per hour for those workers. Workers under 21, apprentices and trainees not covered by an award, have a minimum wages set at a percentage of the ordinary rate. For those under 16, this is 36.8% or A$7.30 per hour; A$9.13 with the casual loading.
129,035 CFA franc ($224) per month.

800,000 Lao kip ($100) per month; additionally, employers were required to pay a 30,000-kip ($3.74) meal allowance per day. The minimum wage for civil servants and state enterprise employees was last increased to 1,400,000 kip ($170) per month.

The minimum wage in the United Kingdom is: £8.91 ($11) per hour for those aged 23+ £8.36 ($11) per hour for those aged 21–22 £6.56 ($8) per hour for those aged 18–20 £4.62 ($6) per hour for under 18 £4.30 ($5) per hour for apprentices aged 16 to 18 and those aged 19 or over who are in their first year
NZ$ 20 per hour for workers 18 years old or older, and NZ$16 per hour for those aged 16 or 17 or in training; there is no statutory minimum wage for employees who are aged 15 years or under.
2825.90 Turkish liras ($384) per month (After Taxes).
₴ 6000 (UAH) ($215.67) per month 36.11 hryvnias ($1.30) per hour Annual wage $2530 US.

1500€ per month before taxes ; National collective bargaining agreements set minimum wages by job classification for each industry and provide for a minimum wage of €1,200 ($1,289) per month. Wages where no such collective agreements exist, such as for domestic workers, janitorial staff and au pairs, are regulated by relevant legislation and are generally lower than those covered by collective bargaining. The national minimum wage legislation has lapsed, although is still in force by convention.
14,900 Macedonian denars ($286) per month.
R21.69 per hour for all workers, except for domestic workers who have a minimum of R19.09, and Expanded Public Works Programme workers who have a minimum of R11.93.
US$182 per month, for the garment and shoe industry.
€1,779.82 per month, or €10.53 per hour; same as the French minimum wage, plus a 5% adjustment.
167,400 HUF ($575.93) per month for unskilled labor, 219,000 HUF ($753.46) per month for skilled labor.

Set by the government by location, age and skill level; the lowest agricultural minimum wage for unskilled employees was 6,415.55 Kenyan shillings per month, 269.40 per day, excluding housing allowance.
€758 ($853) per month in 12 payments, €650 ($732) per month in 14 payments, or €5.71 ($6.51) per hour.

2,112,562 Paraguayan guaraníes ($348) per month; The law discriminates against domestic workers, who are legally entitled to only 40 percent of the minimum wage. The law mandates that housing and food be counted towards domestic worker's salary.
US$3.00 per hour; does not include foreign workers.
30,000 Vanuatu vatu ($277) per month, 170 vatu per hour.

None; €870 ($1006) per month for see shop assistants, nurses' assistants, clerks, hairdressers, and nursery assistants; it rises to €924 ($1069) after six months' employment. For asylum seekers working as unskilled workers in the agricultural sector, the minimum monthly wage was 425 euros ($570) with accommodation and food provided. For skilled workers in the agricultural sector, the minimum salary was 767 euros ($1040) without accommodation and food.
908 526 Colombian pesos + 106 454 by transportation subsidy ($290) per month
250 Azerbaijani manat ($146) per month.
3,000 Saudi riyals ($800) per month for public sector; does not apply to foreign workers. There are no minimum wage in private sector.
50 dalasi ($1.25) per day.
37600 Syrian pounds ($13 Black Market) per month, plus benefits, including compensation for meals, uniforms, and transportation.
3.20 Papua New Guinean kina ($1) per hour.
None;1,000 Rwandan francs ( $1.02) per day in the tea industry and 1500 to 5000 francs ($1.52 to $5.08) per day in the construction industry.
450 Libyan dinars ($73 Black market) per month; the government heavily subsidizes rent and utilities.
90,000 CFA francs ($170) per month in the formal sector.
£8.70 per hour ($11.60) for those aged 18+ £8.25 per hour ($11.00) for those aged 17–18.
406 convertible marks ($240) net per month.

5,500 Afghani ($67) per month for non-permanent private sector. The minimum wage for permanent government workers was 6,000 Afghanis ($74) per month. There was no minimum wage for permanent workers in the private sector.

None; wages normally fall within a national scale negotiated by labor, employers, and local governments. Skilled workers earn a minimum of NOK 197.90 per hour, while unskilled workers with no experience should earn at least NOK 177.80(21.5 $)per hour makes 3440 $ per month. That rises to NOK 185.50 after one year's experience. Young workers under the age of 18 must earn at least NOK 119.30.
4400 Turkish liras ($525) per month (gross minimum wage).
AUD$1.30 per hour for local businesses and companies, while the minimum wage for overseas-funded projects is AUD$3.00 an hour
EC$4.00 ($1.50) per hour.
610 Bulgarian lev (€313) per month, 3.68 lev (€1.9) per hour.
300 BHD ($800) per month for the public sector workers for secondary school graduates, 450 BHD($1196) for bachelor degree graduates.(only applies to Bahraini nationals).

8,590 won (US$7.5 or $8.6 PPP) per hour is the nominal minimum wage in South Korea, The minimum wage law applies equally to foreign, temporary or young workers covering all industries and regions nationwide.

81.87 Guatemalan quetzales ($10.90) per day for agricultural and nonagricultural work and 74.89 quetzales ($10.00) per day for work in export-sector regime factories. Minimum wage earners also are due a mandatory monthly bonus of 250 quetzales ($33), and salaried workers receive two mandatory yearly bonuses (the bono 14 and the Christmas bonus), each equivalent to one month's salary.
9.68 Ghanaian cedis ($1.7) per day.
None.
J$7,000 ($53) per week.
35,000 ($65) CFA francs per month.
None

Ranges from 313 to 336 baht ($10.35–11.10) per day and up, depending on the cost of living in various provinces; set by provincial tripartite wage committees that sometimes include only employer representatives.
31,747.36 Serbian dinars ($302.59) net monthly. Also, 172.54 Serbian dinars ($1.64) per hour net, and 232.92 Serbian dinars ($2.22) per hour gross.
SI$4.00 ($0.55) per hour for all workers except those in the fishing and agricultural sectors, who received SI$3.20 per hour.
209.10 CFA francs ($0.42) per hour for general workers and 182.95 CFA francs ($0.37) per hour for agricultural workers.
None.

Varies by sector; K993.60 Zambian kwacha ($47) per month for domestic workers. Shop workers' minimum wage is K1,698.60 with transport, lunch and housing allowances inclusive, and wages increasing according to the grades of employees, with the minimum wage of the highest grade in this category being K3,558.90. In the general workers' category, which includes receptionists and guards among others, the minimum wage for category one workers is K1,698.60, while the highest category is at K3,151.61.
55,000 Comorian francs ($129) per month.
None; the mining, construction, security and agricultural sectors set basic levels of pay through collective bargaining.
US$2.00 per hour for government and private sector employees.
NT$24,000 (US$856.6) per month; NT$160 (US$5.71) per hour is the minimum wage in Taiwan.

The minimum wage in Canada is set by each province and territory; ranges from $11.45 to $16 CAD per hour. The minimum wage calculated here is a weighted average based on the relative population in each province.
Minimum wages ranged from a low of 6,096.71 Honduran lempiras per month, 25.41 lempiras per hour to 10,698.30 lempiras per month, 44.58 lempiras per hour.
34,664 CFA francs ($59) per month.
None; 3,100 Maldivian rufiyaa ($202) per month in the government sector.

326,500 Chilean pesos ($440) per month for workers aged 18–65; or 243,561 pesos ($318) per month for workers younger than 18 and older than 65; and 210,458 pesos ($260) per month for 'non remunerative' purposes.
225 Omani rials ($592) per month plus allowances of 100 rials ($263) per month for citizens; does not apply to foreign workers.

None; US$2.65 per hour for employment with the national government; all states have a minimum hourly wage for government workers: $2.00 in Pohnpei, $1.25 in Chuuk, $1.42 in Kosrae, and $1.60 in Yap; $1.75 for private sector workers in Pohnpei.
US$115 per month.

1,100 Brazilian reais per month ($ 211.81), paid 13 times a year. The Brazilian minimum wage is adjusted annually by the federal government. Each Brazilian state has its own minimum wage, which cannot be lower than the federal minimum wage. In 2021, only the three states of the South Region, São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro set higher state values; the other states decided to follow the national value.
G$35,000 (US$168) per month, or G$1,616 (US$7) per day, or G$202 (US$1) per hour.
1,178 maloti ($102) per month to 1,285 maloti ($112) per month; varied by sector.
€9.35 ($10.68) per hour is the minimum wage in Germany. A higher minimum wage is often set by collective bargaining agreements and enforceable by law.

Though stipulated by law, it varies from 160 rupees ($2.27) per day in Bihar, Rs. 348/day ($4.94) in Mumbai (2017) 750 rupees ($11) per day in Kerala. State governments set a separate minimum wage for agricultural workers. The minimum wages are set according to Minimum Wages Act, 1948.

RM1200 ($296) per month, or RM4.81 ($1.1) per hour on the peninsula; and RM920 ($224) per month, or RM4.42 ($1.0) per hour for the states of Sabah, Sarawak, and Labuan. To be fully enforced on July 1, 2016.
930 Peruvian soles ($294) per month.
EC$9.00 per hour.

The federal nationwide minimum wage in the United States is US$7.25 per hour. States may also set a minimum, in which case the higher of the two is controlling; some territories are exempt and have lower rates. As of July 1, 2019, effective state minimum wage rates range from $7.25 to $14.00 per hour. Local government minimum wages exist as well, the highest of which reach to $16 per hour.

None; instead, negotiated between unions and employer associations; the average minimum wage for all private and public sector collective bargaining agreements was approximately DKK 110 (nominally $16) per hour, exclusive of pension benefits.
500,000 Sierra Leonean leones ($49) per month.
£8.32 per hour ($10.27) for those aged 18+ £7.28 per hour ($8.99) for trainees year 2 £6.02 per hour ($7.43) for trainees year 1.
BZ$3.30 ($1.65) per hour.
None; there is a graduated salary system for public service officers and employees, none for private-sector workers.
60 Kuwaiti dinars ($216) per month.
€886.63 per month.

290 Haitian gourdes per day for servants for an eight-hour workday; 400 Haitian gourdes per day for segment A industries; 350 Haitian gourdes per day for segment B industries; 290 Haitian gourdes per day for segment C industries; 350 Haitian gourdes per day for companies with piece work that re-export; and 350 Haitian gourdes per day for companies with piece work that exports.

None, except for agricultural and domestic workers; government regulations for each of the 22 industrial sectors specify minimum wages. The minimum wage for all mine workers is currently pegged at $227 per month.

2122 Bolivian bolivianos ($300) per month. plus an obligatory Christmas bonus equal to one month's pay, prorated for the amount of time the worker has worked in their present position. Plus a second Christmas Bonus if the government decries the economy grew enough, plus an extra month paid in May if the company made a profit for the previous year.

The minimum wage in China is set locally; ranges from RMB1,120 ($161.07) per month, or RMB10.60 ($1.52) per hour in Liaoning; to RMB2,420 ($348.02) per month, or RMB21.00 ($3.02) per hour in Shanghai.
None
₪5,300 ($1613) per month; or ₪29.12 ($8.86) per hour. For construction workers: ₪5,600 ($1705) per month; or ₪30.76 ($9.36) per hour
13,000 Cape Verdean escudos ($141) per month.

1,500 taka ($19) per month for all economic sectors not covered by industry-specific wages; in the garment industry the minimum wage raised to 8,000 taka ($95) per month since 1 December 2018. The minimum wage is set nationally every five years by the National Minimum Wage Board in a tripartite forum industry by industry.

€10.20 ($11.65) per hour, with sub-minimal rates for those under 18 (70% of minimum), and for those over 18 in first year of employment (80%), in second year of employment (90%).  Eurostat calculates the monthly rate for Ireland as (hourly rate × 39 hours × 52 weeks) / 12 months
10,000 rupees ($53) per month.The minimum wages are set according to National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No. 3 of 2016
None; 750,000 São Tomé and Príncipe dobras ($37.5) per month for civil servants

26,000 Albanian lekë ($240) per month, in private sector and 37,000 lekë ($332) per month in public sector. The law establishes a 40-hour workweek, but the actual workweek is typically set by individual or collective-bargaining agreement.
2,800 PLN ($729) per month, or 18.30 PLN ($4.77) per hour is the minimum wage in Poland.
531.6 Swazi emalangeni ($76.50) per month for a domestic worker; 420 emalangeni ($60.50) a month for an unskilled worker; 600 emalangeni ($86.50) a month for a skilled worker.

5.46 Botswana pula ($0.58) an hour for most full-time labor in the private sector; 3.03 ($0.29) Botswana pula per hour for domestic workers or approximately 24.24 pula ($2.28) a day; 620 Botswana pula ($60) per month for workers in the agriculture sector.

Varies for specified industries from ₡10,060.75 ($16.73) per 8-hour work day for all workers to ₡13,141.39 ($23) per day for specialized workers. All other occupations not explicitly covered fall under the generic scale, which varies from ₡300,255.79 ($528) per month for unskilled workers to ₡644,689.30 ($1134) per month for licentiates.
€1050.40 per month, €6.06 per hour.

The mimimum wage in Venezuela is 10,000,000 Venezuelan bolívars per month, including a food bond the total raises up to 3,000,000 bolívars, which is equivalent to about US$3.54 per month as May 1, 2021.
MK 687.70 per day.
2775 Moldovan lei ($156) per month in the private sector.

Set sector by sector; for example, EC$56 ($20.74) per day for agriculture workers (shelter not provided); EC$40 ($14.81) per day for industrial workers; and EC$25 per day for household domestic workers.

None; in Sweden the law provides for the right of workers to form and join independent unions to bargain wages collectively, and it prohibits antiunion discrimination. As of 2021, in the hotel and restaurant industry, the minimum salary in Sweden is of 23854 SEK or 2850 USD.
133,013.40 Malagasy ariary per month, 767.40 ariary per hour for non-agricultural workers; 134,920.00 ariary per month, 674.60 ariary per hour for agricultural workers.
Minimum wage for some sectors; EC$300 ($111) per month for office clerks; EC$200 ($74) for shop assistants; EC$160 ($59) for messengers.
535 Turkmenistani manat ($19 Black market) per month.

2,655,495 Iranian tomans (equal to 26,554,950 rials), and to ($114) per month effective on the 2021 Persian New year; set annually for each industrial sector and region. The standard workweek is 44 hours, and any work over 48 entitles the worker to overtime.
250,000 Iraqi dinars ($214) per month.
SR38.27 ($1.81) per hour for all workers other than casual workers, SR5.804 ($274) per month.
B$5.25 ($5.25) per hour, B$42 ($42) per day, and B$210 ($210) per week.

Established by provincial and district authorities, which vary by province, district, and sector; the lowest minimum wage is in the province of Yogyakarta at rupiah 1,704,608 (US$121) per month and the highest is in Jakarta at rupiah 4,276,349 (US$303) per month.
Set for nine different economic sectors; ranges from 3,187.43 Nicaraguan córdobas per month in the agricultural sector to 7,133.44 córdobas per month in the financial sector.

None; some government institutions and public enterprises set their own minimum wages: public sector employees, the largest group of wage earners, earned a monthly minimum wage of 420 Ethiopian birr ($10); employees in the banking and insurance sector had a minimum monthly wage of 336 birr ($8).

US$466.66 per month (for month average, including proportional 13th and 14th salaries and minimal 15 days vacation period). The minimum wage has been set by the government at $400, per month without social benefits for the year 2020, but a worker also receives mandatory 13rd and a 14th salary.
19,030 CFA francs ($30) per month plus a bag of rice
3,000 Mauritanian Ouguiya (30,000 Old Ouguiya, $83.8 in 2017 terms) per month for adults.
€1108 ($1266) per month in 12 payments, €950 ($1085) per month in 14 payments.
20,000 Algerian dinars ($156.19) per month, nationally.
Set for nine different economic sectors; ranges from 3,002 Mozambican meticias ($40) per month in the public sector, to 7,465 meticias ($129) per month in the financial sector.
36,270 CFA francs ($62) per month.
€741 per month ($800) in 12 payments; €635 per month ($685) in 14 payments for full-time workers, rural workers, and domestic employees ages 18 and older.
€642 ($693) per month, €4.01 ($4.58) per hour for unskilled labor. Although, 141 article of the Labour code of Lithuania requires to pay more for the skilled labor.

1.53 to 4.45 balboas ($1.53–$4.45 USD) per hour, depending on region and sector. Food and the use of housing facilities were considered part of the salary for some workers, such as domestic and agricultural workers. Salaries for domestic workers ranged from 250 to 275 balboas ($250-$275 USD) per month. The agricultural and construction sectors received the lowest and highest minimum wages, respectively.
€2,071.10 ($2366) per month, €11.97 ($13.67) per hour for unskilled workers over 18; increased by 20% for a skilled employee; decreased by 20% to 25% in the case of an adolescent worker.
420,000 Mongolian tögrög ($147) per month.
None; instead set generally through collective bargaining agreements on a sector-by-sector basis.

None; however, the law requires all employers, including non-unionized ones, to pay minimum wages agreed to in collective bargaining agreements; almost all workers are covered under such arrangements.
None.
40,000 CFA francs ($70) per month; the government set minimum wage scales for a number of occupations.
30,000 naira per month (following the recent devaluation of the naira has fallen to $76.92, or $66.60 using the parallel market rate).
3000 Sudanese pounds ($12 Black market) per month. See Minimum wage in Sudan.
59,995 CFA francs ($110) per month, 355 CFA francs ($0.6) per hour.
15 Liberian dollars per hour not exceeding 8 hours per day, excluding benefits, for unskilled laborers; 5,600 LD per month for civil servants.

None; canceled by the 2006 Labor Code for occupational categories, establishing that wages be set after common agreement between employers and employees. For public sector workers, minimum wage was 35,000 DFJ ($198) per month.
250 Tajikistani somoni ($21) per month, plus certain government subsidies for workers and their families.
FJ$2.68 per hour.
EC$8.20 per hour (US$3.03).

None. However, two exceptions: 1) Cleaner jobs to have a minimum wage of 1,236 Singapore dollars ($915) per month effective July 2020. 2) Security guards to have a minimum wage of 1,100 SGD ($802) per month effective September 2016.

141.70 Mexican pesos ($7.36) per day; 213.39 Mexican pesos ($11.08) per day on the Free Zone of the Northern Border. Day off is paid according to Mexican labor legislation so the total amount of paid hours is 56 (Art. 69) but the working hours are 48.
WST$2.00 ($0.89) per hour for the private sector; WST$2.65 ($1.18) for the public sector.
TT$17.50 ($2.58) per hour., ($449) per month
The minimum wage was set by the government at $304.17 monthly in 2018.

For the industrial sector: 340 Tunisian dinars ($126) per month for a 48-hour workweek and 290 dinars ($120) per month for a 40‑hour workweek; 9 dinars ($3.70) to 14 dinars ($5.7) per day for agricultural workers; supplemented with transportation and family allowances.
3,750 Bhutanese ngultrum per month.
130,000 Ugandan shillings ($34.58) per month.
17,930 Uruguayan pesos ($423) per month.

150,000 CFA francs ($255) per month; government workers received an additional monthly allowance of 20,000 CFA francs ($34) per child; government workers also received transportation, housing, and family benefits; the law does not mandate housing or family benefits for private sector workers.
Varies by occupation, with the lowest set to 36,607 CFA franc ($72) per month for the industrial sector; a slightly higher minimum wage rate is applied for construction workers.
30,047 CFA francs ($60) per month.
1140 Kyrgyzstani som ($13) per month, nominally; used for administrative purpose.
17500 Pakistani rupees ($128) per month.
€170 ($224) per month for workers between 35 and 65 years of age; €130 ($150) for workers under 35 years of age.
20 Georgian lari ($8) per month for private sector workers which has remained unchanged since the early 1990s but is not applied in practice; 115 lari ($48) per month for public employees.
The minimum civil service wage was 21,000 rials ($84) per month.
35,000 CFA francs per month, 218.75 CFA francs per hour.
24,408 Argentine pesos ($245) per month for up to 200 hours; paid thirteen times a year.
14,600.00 Czech koruna per month, ($637) or 87.30 koruna per hour.
220 Jordanian dinars ($310) per month.
None; in the past the government set the minimum wage, but during the year the minimum wage was set by market forces.
€623 ($712) per month, or €3.58 ($4.09) per hour.
634,880 Uzbekistani som ($60) per month.
Varies by sector from 40,000 Tanzanian shillings ($17) per month, to 400,000 shillings ($174) per month.
Averaging 5,000 – 10,000 North Korean won ($5.5 – $11.1) per day.
Minimum wage schedules set pay by occupation; for example, the minimum wage for domestic workers, for example, was EC$4.50 per hour, while that for a security guard was EC$8.00 per hour.

€1,680.00 ($1919) per month, €381.60 per week, €76.32 per day, and €9.54 ($10.9) per hour for persons 21 and older (in a 40-hours work week, €10.05 per hour in a 38-hours workweek and €10.60 per hour in a 36-hours workweek); between 30% and 80% (as low as €2.87 per hour) of this amount for persons aged 15–20.
None; 360 Eritrean nakfa ($24) per month in the public sector.
The minimum wage in Croatia is 3,750 Croatian kuna per month. ($566)
13,450 Nepalese rupees ($119) per month
3 000 MADs ($310) per month in public sector, 2 570.86 MAD ($265) per month in private sector, 69,73 MAD ($7) per day for agricultural workers.
None; SRD 600 ($42) per month is the lowest wage for civil servants.
2.300 lei ($573.85) per month; else 1.444 lei ($3.43) per hour for a full-time schedule of 167 hours per month is the minimum wage in Romania.
21,454 kwanza ($58) per month; paid thirteen times a year.
€500 ($571) per month.
28,284 Kazakhstani tenge ($67) per month is the minimum wage in Kazakhstan.
1,680 Congolese francs ($1.83) per day.
For the public sector the minimum wage is LE2,400 ($150) per month.

€778.34 ($889) per month, or €169.76 ($194) per week; combined with an annual mandatory bonus of €270.20 ($309) and a €242.32 ($277) annual cost of living increase, automatically adjusted for inflation.

None; minimum wages are negotiated in various collectively bargained agreements and applied automatically to all employees in those occupations, regardless of union membership; while the agreements can be either industry- or sector-wide, and in some cases firm-specific, the minimum wage levels are occupation-specific The Efling, one of the biggest workers' union in Iceland, has its own minimum wage figures. In Efling, as of 2021 the minimum salary in Iceland is of 351,000 ISK (2850$)per month for a full time position. Although this might not apply to all classes of workers in Iceland, it is a pretty standard figure for the country.
3,600 Myanmar kyat per day, 450 Myanmar kyat per hour.
€193 ($215) per month.
6656 Macanese patacas ($833) per month.
None; the minimum annual salary in the public sector was approximately A$3,000 to A$4,000 ($2320 to $3092).

1000 Qatari riyals ($274) per month (in addition to the minimum wage, following applies; the provision of 500 riyals ($137) for accommodation and 300 riyals ($82.2) for food if those expenses are not provided as part of the contract).
None
BDS$6.25 ($3.13) per hour for household domestics and shop assistants; the Ministry of Labor recommends all other sectors use this as the de facto minimum wage.
HK$37.50 (US$4.83) per hour is the minimum wage in Hong Kong.
